bug.short_desc: Focus not always on window on top of the z axis
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Using 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation HD Graphics 520 (rev 07)
Frequently, the keyboard and mouse focus is not set to the window on top of the z axis. For instance, clicking a new program will open it underneath the currently selected application, and it has the focus. The top app can't even be used.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible: No logic to it. One just has a window that is not taking input, because the window below is grabbing it.
Additional info:
Seems to happen more with windows that appear by being moved from other workspaces, but sometimes happens with newly opened applications.

This is probably a duplicate of bug #1376540. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1376540
The problem also occurs on computers with Nvidia GPU, and applies also to MATE 1.16 from EPEL7. - mate-desktop.x86_64 - 1.16.1-3.el7 from @epel - marco.x86_64 - 1.16.0-1.el7 from @epel - kmod-nvidia.x86_64 - 375.39-2.el7.elrepo from @elrepo - nvidia-x11-drv.x86_64 - 375.39-1.el7.elrepo from @elrepo

As this issue isn't easy to reproduce in need your help. Please test those marco builds. I reverted a commit and i can't duplicate the issue any more since 2 days. For f26: https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=19369066 For f25: https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=19369224 For f24: https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=19369240 rhel7/cento7: https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=19369256
marco-1.16.0-2.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-4a48af810a
marco-1.16.0-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-54e2fdc876
(In reply to Wolfgang Ulbrich from comment #2) I was unable to reproduce this error within the last 4 days of normal work.
